alert.note: Alert for Banner; Box Butte; Morrill; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 5:41PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Box Butte, Scotts Bluff, northwestern Morrill, northwestern Banner and southeastern Sioux Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 441 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hubbard Hill, or 7 miles southwest of Scottsbluff, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Mitchell, Terrytown, Minatare, Lake Minatare Campground, Scotts Bluff National Monument, Hubbard Hill, Moomaws Corner, Scottsbluff Airport, Lake Minatare, Lake Alice and Melbeta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Banner; Box Butte; Morrill; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux
